required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Online "Pain, Stress & Emotions" Class in Chronic Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Online "Pain, Stress & Emotions" Class in Chronic Pain: Single-arm Efficacy Test

brief_summary.textblock: Members with chronic pain will be invited to participate in a 2-hour zoom-delivered pain psychology class entitled "Pain, Stress, & Emotions". Surveys are completed at baseline (prior to the online class), a satisfaction survey is completed after the class, and post-treatment surveys completed 2, 4, 8, and 12 1weeks after class attendance.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Uncontrolled, prospective, single arm, pre-post intervention study

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to 1-Month follow-up (with secondary 2-month follow-up)

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System: Pain Interference short form 6a
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to 1-Month follow-up (with secondary 2-month follow-up)

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System: Depression 6a
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to 1-Month follow-up (with secondary 2-month follow-up)

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System: Anxiety 6a
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to 1-Month follow-up (with secondary 2-month follow-up)

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System: Physical Function 8b
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to 1-Month follow-up (with secondary 2-month follow-up)

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System: Sleep Disturbance 6a
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to 1-Month follow-up (with secondary 2-month follow-up)

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System: social isolation 6a
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to 1-Month follow-up (with secondary 2-month follow-up)

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System: fatigue 6a
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to 1-Month follow-up (with secondary 2-month follow-up)

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System: anger 5a
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to 1-Month follow-up (with secondary 2-month follow-up)
Change from baseline to 1-Month follow-up (with secondary 2-month follow-up)
secondary_outcome.description: self-reported ambivalence levels about emotional expression

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to 1-Month follow-up (with secondary 2-month follow-up)
Change from baseline to 1-Month follow-up (with secondary 2-month follow-up)
secondary_outcome.description: single-item assessing self-reported levels of pain bothersomeness

other_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to 1-Month follow-up (with secondary 2-month follow-up)
other_outcome.description: Two self-report questionnaires were developed to assess psychological and brain influences on pain. The 4-item psychological attribution scale assesses patients' beliefs that their thoughts and feelings and psychological therapy impacts pain, and the 3-item brain attribution scale assesses patient's beliefs that their pain is brain-based. Mean scores will be computed for both scales separately (0-4; higher scores indicating greater belief that pain is a brain-related [brain attribution] construct and that pain is affected by thoughts, feelings, and psychological interventions [psychological attribution])

other_outcome.measure: Pain Catastrophizing Scores; measured with Pain Catastrophizing Scale
other_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline to 1-Month follow-up (with secondary 2-month follow-up)
other_outcome.description: Pain Catastrophizing Scale (Sullivan et al., 1995): A summed score of the 13 catastrophizing items will be computed (0-52, higher scores indicate greater catastrophizing)

arm_group.description: No active or placebo comparator will be used. This is a single-arm study design.

intervention.description: 2-hour, zoom-delivered, group intervention focused on teaching patients how pain is processed in their brain and learning about the role of psychosocial factors in their pain conditions.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Chronic pain condition (pain > 3 months)
- Access to the internet
- English fluency
Exclusion Criteria:
- Ongoing legal action or disability claim
- Cognitive impairment, non-English speaking, or psychological factors that would preclude comprehension of material and/or full participation in the study.
